trans-unit.source: Specifies the filter string and filter type to use for a toolbox item.

<xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> provides a mechanism by which toolbox items can be marked for use only with designers that have a matching attribute or code that determines whether the item should be enabled or disabled in the toolbox.

A <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> can be applied to a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> to indicate a filter string and filter type that specify when to enable or disable the item.
<xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> can also be applied to a designer to indicate its requirements for enabling items in the toolbox.
This type of attribute can be used to indicate that a toolbox item can only be enabled when a designer with a matching filter string is being used.

The type of the filter is indicated in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute.FilterType%2A> property by a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterType> that indicates whether and how a filter string match is used, or whether to use custom code to determine whether to enable an item.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute"></xref> class using the specified filter string.
The filter string for the toolbox item.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute"></xref> class using the specified filter string and type.
The filter string for the toolbox item.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterType"></xref> indicating the type of the filter.
Returns a value that indicates whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to compare with this instance or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
`true` if obj equals the type and value of this instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the filter string for the toolbox item.
The filter string for the toolbox item.
Gets the type of the filter.

The type of the filter, along with any existing <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> on the current designer, indicates the rules to use to determine whether a particular toolbox item should be enabled in the toolbox.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterType"></xref> that indicates the type of the filter.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Indicates whether the specified object has a matching filter string.
The object to test for a matching filter string.
`true` if the specified object has a matching filter string; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets the type ID for the attribute.
The type ID for this attribute.
All <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute"></xref> objects with the same filter string return the same type ID.
